architectural_decisions.title: Use of Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To create a scalable and maintainable system that can be developed, deployed, and scaled independently.

architectural_decisions.title: FastAPI and Pydantic for Building REST API
architectural_decisions.rationale: For efficient development, robust data validation, and easy integration with other services.

architectural_decisions.title: Repository Pattern for Data Access Layer
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access logic and provide a clean interface for CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Dependency Injection for Managing Dependencies
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure loose coupling between components and improve testability.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling Using FastAPI's HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: To provide meaningful error responses and simplify error handling.

architectural_decisions.title: Support for Multiple Payment Providers
architectural_decisions.rationale: To offer flexibility and cater to different user preferences.

architectural_decisions.title: JWT Tokens for Authentication and Authorization
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure secure authentication and authorization mechanisms.

architectural_decisions.title: ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To facilitate seamless interaction with the relational database.

architectural_decisions.title: Notifications for Order Confirmations
architectural_decisions.rationale: To enhance user experience by providing timely notifications about order status changes.

Create and Manage Orders.description: API endpoints for creating, managing, and retrieving orders in an e-commerce application.

steps.description: Create a new order by sending a POST request to /api/orders/create with order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Retrieve the details of a specific order using a GET request to /api/orders/{order_id}. Only the owner of the order can access it.
List all orders for the current user with pagination support via limit and offset parameters on a GET request to /api/orders/.
Cancel a pending order by sending a POST request to /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel. Processing or shipped orders cannot be cancelled.
